result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey J Schneider was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeffrey J Schneider was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

Blood Test Reimbursement:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court and to be forwarded to the Village of Mukwonago Police Department as a Condition of Probation.

 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey J Schneider in court with Attorney Daniel P Fay.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fay makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - __ days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -    2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Attend 2 self-help meetings per week when attending Day Report Center
*Must have sponsor within 45 days   
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*Attend Victim Impact Panel on 8/19/15  

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to Village of Mukwonago Police Department);

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  6 MONTHS, Non-working hours with standard release condition - CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #3 - 

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**Court orders SCRAM monitoring to be removed**


COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE:     **CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #1** 

HUBER:  12 MONTHS (86 DAYS CREDIT), LAST 6 MONTHS STAYED.  Release for work, treatment.  Defendant already in huber 

DAY REPORT CENTER:  6 MONTHS, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 6 MONTHS of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed. 

COSTS:  WAIVED

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program    Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant is allowed huber bailee privileges with scram installed WILL INCLUDE RELEASE FOR TREATMENT.
